TopicTitle: Vagani Car Manufacturers- Get Inspired- Final Challenge

Articles.Content:
Here is my finial entry the Sand Dune MK4

http://i.imgur.com/Kb6OWxw.png

It has 153 parts a top speed of 21.5m/s and weighs about 7 tonnes. It is basically an upgrade of my last rover.

Great craft you were luckey only 1hour left can't wait to see the winner

Great craft you were luckey only 1hour left can't wait to see the winner [

I am glad you like my craft. Thank you

no idea XD, guess I'll come with something for tomorrow, might ask my friends at school

here is my "rover" no name quite yet, pretty sturdy. each wheel has it's own suspension

hotkeys -

1- basic boost

2- underhood mono engines to right the vehicle after flips -

0-drop landercanincludes built in car jacks for those inevitable flat tires. - (it's also amphibious - note the air intakes)

(it's also amphibious - note the air intakes)

Specs =

Cost - 56016

Weight - 14.28 tons

Part count - 224

Top Speed - 54m/s

Top Speed on water - 3.3m/s (lol)

The Kerbswagen Pillbug!

Enjoy your Pillbug, and let me know what you think.

UpsilonAerospace, just wanted to quickly pop on and say that I had a blast speeding around on the Mun in your Pillbug ( In four-wheel drive mode of course! )
go on aesthetics ill let you in, as you did post on the 17th and the time might of not been the most available for you

UpsilonAerospace, just wanted to quickly pop on and say that I had a blast speeding around on the Mun in your Pillbug ( In four-wheel drive mode of course! )

http://files.the14th.eu/forum/2014/2014-09-18c.jpg

That's awesome! I'm currently working on a way to air-drop the Pillbug... initial tests look promising.

Getting it to the Mun is a bit cooler, though.

How does it handle in the low-gravity conditions? I haven't tested it out on the Mun, yet.

Edited September 18, 2014 by UpsilonAerospace

Sorry to double-post, but the video for the Pillbug-dropping plane is out.

Not bad, eh? Unfortunately, the added mass of the parachutes makes the Pillbug a little less happy than it otherwise would be. Still, though. Air-dropping rovers is fun.

That's awesome! I'm currently working on a way to air-drop the Pillbug... initial tests look promising.

Pretty nifty!

Whenever I try something like this, I have trouble keeping the two craft within the de-spawn distance.

How does it handle in the low-gravity conditions? I haven't tested it out on the Mun, yet.

Obviously there's not much traction in 2-wheel drive mode, but lock in that 4X4 mode and I was happily scooting around at about 25-28 m/s

First challenge, out it on a rocket by anyways possible and land it on minmus and take a screeny of the car on minmus, video optional but you must show your events screen so i know you havent hyperedited

Ok I finished the first challenge. It wasn't that hard, i just strapped rockets on the sides (imagine a real world rocket scientist say that). Anyways here are the photos which show my departure, my arrival, and what happened in-between.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

go on aesthetics ill let you in, as you did post on the 17th and the time might of not been the most available for you

Wait. I'm all for entries into the competition (and aesthetics' craft looks like it's pretty nice) but I wish that everyone would post specs, like it says in the rules.

I'm not saying that he shouldn't be allowed into the competition. I'm just saying that while he posted his design reasonably close to the deadline, he still hasn't posted specs yet, which was one of the most important parts of the post.

Aesthetics, if you're reading this, could you please post the specs for this craft soon? That would probably be appreciated by Vagani, and it would certainly be appreciated by me. Thanks, and sorry to be a bother.

Hang on, i realised something...

Are the Events testing for stuff like crash tolerance and off road performance? If so, can I remove my original craft from the competition and enter a whole new one in its place?
Sure, and yes it will be stuff like that

The second event will probably be a Minmus Performance event, not sure which one, but it will be one.

Also, im pretty sure kerbals don't have to be in the vehicle that is getting to Minmus, could probably use this to spare weight.

EDIT: Edited my entry post to show the 1st challenge being done.

Your move, Roflcopter.

EDIT EDIT: Is it a coincidence that we have a challenge where we deliver rovers to minmus, after EE, HOC, and ChickenKeeper did that in part 9 of their DMP series?

So I know I am a few days late but this thread and seeing all the awesome creations that you guys made inspired me to make an attempt.

part count 110

Top speed 23m/s

Cost-89k

I found that it does not work as well on Minimus but it had a good run on Duna.

you could do a endurance test eg how fast it can go before tipping over or how much damage it can withstand or something like that ???

you could do a endurance test eg how fast it can go before tipping over or how much damage it can withstand or something like that ???

I think you would need to be more specific on the details...

How fast it goes before tipping/flipping over in a straight line on the runway, a straight line not on the runway, or a turn?

How much damage it can withstand after a crash into the VAB or a shot from a missile launcher?

If there is gonna be a challenge that is something like the latter, we would probably lose a point per part that is lost from the original part count, Top Gear style.
